title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 21 March 2017 - XWiki
content:
<mflorea> has quit  
07:03 <D-Spair> has quit  
07:10 <D-Spair> has joined #xwiki  
08:13 <msmeria> has joined #xwiki  
09:17 <acotiuga> has joined #xwiki  
09:17 <KermitTheFragger> has joined #xwiki  
09:35 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
09:48 <jeremycahill[m]> has joined #xwiki  
10:17 <Slashman> has joined #xwiki  
10:17 <vmassol> starting to download and test admin ui reorg from the latest snapshot  
10:46 <sgc072> has joined #xwiki  
10:48 <vmassol> mflorea: comment1: "PANELS DISPLAYED ON THE LEFT" is a bit technical and appears before the "Panel List" tab. An improvement would be to make that some advanced section or move them to the Panel List tab somewhere  
10:48 <vmassol> comment2: in L&F, Presentation entry. It doesn't work when I click on it  
10:48 <vmassol> (after having clicked Panels)  
10:48 <sgc\_072> has joined #xwiki  
10:48 <vmassol> (acutally doesn't work even if I don't click on panels)  
10:48 <vmassol> (on chrome)  
10:49 <vmassol> hm seems I cannot click anywhere anymore  
10:49 <mflorea> there's a know problem with the panels section.  
10:49 <vmassol> even when I rfresh the page  
10:49 <mflorea> it only happens when you are in the panel section  
10:49 <vmassol> ah yesI need to change the URL  
10:50 <vmassol> since it points to the panel sections in it  
10:51 <vmassol> comment3: an issue in WYSIWYG editor. Tabs are wrong and no content displayed  
10:52 <sgc072> has quit  
10:55 <mflorea> yes, you need an upgrade on the CK, which I will release today before the 9.2RC1  
10:58 <vmassol> comment4: in Mail, you named the general section "Advanced". In practice it's ok FTM since we have only 1 item in it. We may need to change it in the future if there are more since it wasn't meant to be advanced. It's just that there are 2 parts in Mail config:  
10:58 <vmassol> - part 1: mail sender config  
10:58 <vmassol> - part 2: general mail config  
10:58 <vmassol> comment5: in "Wiki Templates" I see "The environment prevents the table from loading data." in the LT  
10:58 <vmassol> (grr connection lost, rebooting box)  
10:58 <vmassol> comment 6: I can open tabs and they stay open but when I click in a sub category, all the opened tabs are folded.  
10:58 <vmassol> (still connection loss)  
10:58 <vmassol> (on 3G now ;))  
10:59 <vmassol> done with my quick review  
11:07 <vmassol> (mflorea)  
11:08 <vmassol> let me know if you need me to test something special.  
11:21 <vmassol> back on wifi! :)  
11:39 <vmassol> guys we're getting late for the release  
11:39 <vmassol> are we ready?  
11:39 <vmassol> mflorea: ?  
11:39 <vmassol> tmortagne: ?  
11:39 <tmortagne> vmassol: I don't  have anything planned on my side  
11:39 <vmassol> ok cool  
11:39 <vmassol> so mflorea ?  
11:40 <tmortagne> I guess he is working on failing tests  
11:40 <mflorea> I'm fixing tests  
11:40 <vmassol> and bugs in the admin ui too I guess  
11:40 <vmassol> mflorea: I reported some issues/comments above  
11:41 <vmassol> some can be pushed to a future versions, others are bugs to be fixed  
11:47 <mflorea> vmassol: comment1 is not a bug. It was our decision (Caty and mine). You should reply to the mail Caty send for the proposal if you don't agree.  
11:47 <mflorea> comment2: there's a known problem with the Panels section  
11:47 <mflorea> comment3: CKEditor upgrade requried, which is planned before the release  
11:47 <mflorea> comment4: Not a bug. You should comment on the discussion thread  
11:47 <mflorea> comment5: Make sure you clear your browser cache. I don't have it  
11:47 <mflorea> comment6: The expected behavior is to have only one category opened in the menu.  
11:49 <vmassol> re comment6 then you have a bug  
11:49 <vmassol> which is that I was able to open several categories  
11:49 <vmassol> simply by click on their headers  
11:49 <vmassol> \*clicking  
11:50 <vmassol> (mflorea)  
11:50 <mflorea> yes, I have it too  
11:50 <vmassol> personally I liked it :)  
11:50 <vmassol> what I didn't like is that clicking a subcategory would close all  
11:56 <sgc\_072> has quit  
12:42 <gdelhumeau> mflorea: what is the status for the release? are commit locked?  
12:43 <mflorea> gdelhumeau: no, but you should only commit bug fixes, or stuff that can't wait for 9.2 final  
12:47 <gdelhumeau> hmm I guess it can wait it's not that important  
12:47 <gdelhumeau> I create an issue instead and commit on a branch  
12:47 <gdelhumeau> it's minor  
12:51 <gdelhumeau> created XWIKI-14109  
13:27 <sdumitriu> has quit  
13:38 <sgc\_072> has joined #xwiki  
13:42 <sdumitriu> has joined #xwiki  
13:48 <sgc072> has joined #xwiki  
13:50 <sgc\_072> has quit  
14:19 <OSIMasson1> has joined #xwiki  
14:31 <floflobel> has joined #xwiki  
14:31 <floflobel> has quit  
14:46 <zzeroo> has quit  
14:46 <zzeroo> has joined #xwiki  
14:47 <sgc\_072> has joined #xwiki  
14:50 <simfir> has quit  
14:50 <sgc072> has quit  
14:51 <simfir> has joined #xwiki  
15:16 <floflobel> has joined #xwiki  
15:17 <floflobel> has quit  
15:17 <Floflobel\_> has joined #xwiki  
15:33 <Floflobel\_> has quit  
15:47 <sgc\_072\_> has joined #xwiki  
15:49 <Floflobel\_> has joined #xwiki  
15:50 <sgc\_072> has quit  
15:50 <sgc\_072\_> is now known as <sgc\_072>  
16:00 <Floflobel\_> has quit  
16:15 <Floflobel\_> has joined #xwiki  
16:17 <msmeria> has quit  
16:25 <acotiuga> has quit  
16:34 <tmortagne> vmassol: now that the XE LTS (8.4.x) bundles ckeditor, templates app and tour app they should probably be removed from recommended extension on http://extensions.xwiki.org (like other bundled extension they polute a bit the result)  
16:36 <vmassol> good question, I'm not 100% sure  
16:37 <vmassol> on one hand you're right they're not needed because they're bundled but OTOH they also act as advertising for these apps  
16:38 <vmassol> in any case once we start having several flavors we will need them back  
16:38 <vmassol> so we might as well leave them in FTM  
16:38 <vmassol> they are recommended apps  
16:38 <vmassol> it's just that they are bundlded in the XE flavor  
16:39 <vmassol> the blog app should go there soon too once I extract it  
16:40 <tmortagne> it does not need to be extracted to be listed, we have platform extension listed there  
16:40 <tmortagne> it does not need to be extracted to be listed, we have platform extensions listed there  
16:41 <vmassol> right  
16:42 <Floflobel\_> has quit  
16:55 <nirmankarta> has joined #xwiki  
17:19 <vmassol> mflorea: what's the ETA for the release?  
17:32 <orogor> has joined #xwiki  
17:32 <orogor> hi  
17:32 <orogor> any special reason why i need to restart xwiki after adding an ldp user ?  
17:33 <orogor> i see the bind as the proxy user, but no search  
17:33 <tmortagne> orogor: maybe because of the group cache on XWiki side  
17:33 <tmortagne> orogor: maybe because of the LDAP group cache on XWiki side  
17:34 <orogor> i did set xwiki.authentication.ldap.update\_user=1  
17:34 <tmortagne> that's not what I'm talking about  
17:34 <tmortagne> your user is probably in some LDAP group  
17:34 <orogor> and xwiki.authentication.ldap.groupcache\_expiration=1200  
17:35 <orogor> yes it is  
17:35 <tmortagne> and XWiki already have this group in the cache and don't see you modied it right away  
17:36 <tmortagne> you can reset the cache using the LDAP application, you get a button for this in the admin UI  
17:37 <orogor> i dont  have it installed  
17:38 <orogor> neither ldap authenticator or ldap application  
17:38 <orogor> .. it s all done via the conf file and somehow works  
17:38 <tmortagne> what version of XWiki is this ?  
17:39 <orogor> 0.00001 ?  
17:40 \* orogor looks for the excat version string  
17:41 <orogor> core plugins are at 5.0.3  
17:42 <tmortagne> ok so the LDAP authenticator is bundled  
17:42 <tmortagne> you can still install an older version of the LDAP application  
17:42 <orogor> the plugin manager allows me to install it  
17:42 <tmortagne> in details you have "stable versions"  
17:42 <orogor> would it break stuff if i install the ldap application ?  
17:43 <tmortagne> you can't install the last version  
17:43 <orogor> i install the 5.0.3 ?  
17:43 <tmortagne> it requires a more recent version of XWiki  
17:43 <orogor> ok  
17:44 <orogor> but for hr ldap app , i install the 5.0.3 , so i can just frefresh and not restart the wiki ?  
17:44 <tmortagne> the LDAP application is just a UI, installing the 5.0.3 version of the application should not change anything  
17:46 <orogor> humm, it doesn t read the conf from the file  
17:46 <tmortagne> unless 5.0.3 is too old (don't remember) you should get a button to reset the cache from the UI without restarting anything  
17:46 <orogor> yes, i get it  
17:46 <orogor> but the rest of the plugin doesn t show the config i have on the text file  
17:47 <tmortagne> yes it does not read th conf from the xwiki.cfg, it set the configuration at wiki levelm  
17:47 <tmortagne> it's overwritting what's on xwiki.cfg  
17:47 <tmortagne> (if you set something)  
17:48 <tmortagne> in other words it's not exactly the same configuration, it's setting LDAP properties for the current wiki only while xwiki.cfg affect the whole farm  
17:48 <orogor> humm doesnt  seems to work , it says requested ressource isn t availlable  
17:52 <sgc\_072> has quit  
17:55 <KermitTheFragger> has quit  
18:04 <orogor> tmortagne, i confirm , thats a 404  
18:05 <orogor> haa , the page calls 127.0.0.1  
18:15 <orogor> and the app doesnt  support ssl or tls  
18:31 <mflorea> has quit  
18:32 <orogor> tmortagne, apparently that was a very bad idea  
18:32 <orogor> now peoples can t logina nymore  
18:33 <orogor> i tried removing  the plugin, the still the same  
18:33 <orogor> and restart  
18:33 <tmortagne> orogor: you sure you did not set any property ?  
18:33 <orogor> the only session that works are the ones that are still closed  
18:33 <orogor> i tried to set them,but that didnt worked  
18:34 <orogor> should i resinstall the plugin and remove all the properties ?  
18:34 <tmortagne> yes  
18:34 <tmortagne> since you are using xwiki.cfg you should not set any property at wiki level  
18:36 <orogor> ok, i think it works  
18:36 <tmortagne> ok  
18:39 <orogor> ok , i now re-uninstalled it  
18:39 <orogor> i saw it reload the user list in the ldap log when i removed the confs from the plugin  
18:40 <orogor> it scans all users atonce, but not when they login  
18:42 <tmortagne> I assure you the authenticator only do thing during login  
18:42 <tmortagne> but you also have automatic login if your credentials are in the cookie  
18:43 <orogor> in ldap logs  i see the password being verified at login for existing users  
18:44 <orogor> but if the user didnt  existed before startup , i see only a bind with the proxy account, and no search for the user that tries to login  
18:45 <orogor> proxy account binds, do nothing, then exit  
18:45 <tmortagne> again you have a group cache so it's cached in the some previous login  
18:45 <orogor> but group cache should expire no ?  
18:46 <tmortagne> depends on your configuration  
18:46 <orogor> you speak about ldap group cache right ?  
18:46 <tmortagne> yes  
18:47 <tmortagne> as you can see in xwiki.cfg the default is 6 hours  
18:47 <orogor> it s set at 30min here , and group cache work  i ve seen the number of user change  
18:48 <tmortagne> also in old version of XWiki like yours the cache expire only after not being accessed during 6 hours, not after being created  
18:48 <orogor> the number of user in group  
18:48 <orogor> haaaaaaaaaaa  
18:48 <orogor> i supose i can t change this ?  
18:48 <tmortagne> no in this version no  
18:49 <tmortagne> not in this version no  
18:49 <orogor> wll thanks for the info  
18:50 <orogor> enought stress for my little heart today, user can login again , i think it s time to go home  
18:50 <orogor> thanks a lot for your help  
18:55 <orogor> bye  
19:11 <sgc\_072> has joined #xwiki  
20:36 <Slashman> has quit  
21:22 <sgc\_072> has quit  
21:31 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki
